posts.post_content:
Hello all,
Anyone need a HOFer with a difficult back?  T206 Drum backed Vic Willis graded SGC A.  It looks just like a bunch of the other Drums out there.
CARD HAS BEEN TRADED.

I have pulled this one back out of the box and is on the market. I would trade for a bunch of VG HOFers that do not have Piedmont and Sweet Cap backs. Old Mill or Sovereign White Cap Matty in VG-VGEX would be a nice piece of trade bait.

I would consider all HOFers with mid difficulty backs in VG range.

Lets do some trading!!!!



Thanks,
Bob
[url]upperhandisforemost@yahoo.com[/url]

[URL="http://s588.photobucket.com/albums/ss329/upperhandisforemost/T206%20Backs%20Line%20Newest/?action=view&current=T206DrumWillisFront.jpg"][IMG]http://i588.photobucket.com/albums/ss329/upperhandisforemost/T206%20Backs%20Line%20Newest/T206DrumWillisFront.jpg[/IMG][/URL]

Bob

this is a great card -the  grade 3  example sold for over 7k-good luck

Thanks Jim.
It looks like he is a cousin of three of yours!  Same glue, same flat top.
Bob
Hunt had a Drum find and all the examples had the  top trimmed off
did they also all have evidence of glue or damage on the backs?

To some degree, yes.
Thanks,
Bob

none of the backs were super clean but some have no damage

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=15862&d=1269179882[/IMG]
A drum, a drum, McBeth doth come
